image.altText: A fire truck and a fire fighter using a hose to put out a fire.

props.synopsis: The ACT State Emergency Service is urging Canberrans to prepare for fires, floods and storms as the severe weather season begins.

title.children: 'Prepare yourself and your property': Bushfire season begins in ACT

image.altText: Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory

props.synopsis: It can now be revealed that the former student teacher found guilty of sexual offences against a 15-year-old Canberra boy is 28-year-old Petra Shasha, who met the boy during a teaching placement at Canberra's St Edmund's College.

title.children: Teacher found guilty of sexual offences against teenage boy named after suppression order lifted

image.altText: Officer Cadets on parade at ADFA.

props.synopsis: Lawyers for 24-year-old Jake Sullivan are preparing to appeal after he was found guilty of three charges, including rape, last week.

title.children: Former defence cadet found guilty of rape freed on bail by ACT court

image.altText: The exterior of a modern-looking school building

props.synopsis: A former Canberra Marist College student is preparing to sue over the canings and other corporal punishments he allegedly received as a young student in the early 1970s.

title.children: Former Marist College student preparing to sue over alleged historic corporal punishment, sexual abuse

image.altText: Two young nurses in sunglasses hold cardboard posters protesting nurses pay rates

props.synopsis: NSW Health will begin paying an interim 3 per cent wage increase to nurses and midwives, with the union accepting a recommendation from the Industrial Relations Commission to enter into four weeks of negotiation.

title.children: NSW nurses, midwives to receive 3pc backdated pay rise after union accepts government recommendation

image.altText: A woman with an umbrella walks in the University of Sydney quadrangle.

props.synopsis: Anti-Semitism is a "sad indictment" on the Australian university sector, a Senate inquiry has found, but holding a royal commission-like investigation into the issue would be "too slow".

title.children: University responses to anti-Semitism 'woefully inadequate', but Labor-led committee rejects judicial inquiry

image.altText: Five people sit at a table on stage playing dungeons and dragons

props.synopsis: Dungeons & Dragons games are being played live to packed theatre audiences, including at the Sydney Opera House, as the once-niche pastime becomes mainstream.

title.children: Dungeons & Dragons moves from the dining table to the Sydney Opera House

image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

props.synopsis: The 51-year-old Canberra woman sobbed at times and interjected at others, during a court hearing for six charges including threats to kill and attempted aggravated burglary.

title.children: Woman allegedly threatens to kill ex-partner and his neighbour while brandishing crowbar and hammer

image.altText: A crane moves to the site of a damaged apartment in a large building

props.synopsis: The White House said it had intelligence that pointed to an imminent ballistic missile attack on Israel by Iranian forces.

title.children: US warns Iran is planning to strike Israel after IDF strikes on Beirut

image.altText: Numerous large tanks seen in an open area

props.synopsis: A barrage of rockets fired from Lebanon into Israel were partially intercepted, with Hezbollah claiming responsibility.

title.children: Hezbollah rockets reach Tel Aviv as Israel says operation in Lebanon is 'limited'

image.altText: A yellow Hezbollah flag, featuring an arm reaching up to a rifle, seen above a sea of people.

props.synopsis: Federal police are investigating a Melbourne protest where Hezbollah flags were displayed in what shapes as an early test of hate-symbol laws passed earlier this year.

title.children: Appearance of Hezbollah flags at Melbourne rally shape as test of new hate-symbol laws

image.altText: Close up of Julian Assange with him holding up a fist.

props.synopsis: Julian Assange is back on European soil. When last here, he was behind bars.

title.children: 'Isolation has taken its toll': Julian Assange in his first public appearance since his release from a UK prison

image.altText: Corporate grey office building and ABC logo

props.synopsis: The ABC's managing director apologises after a review finds "systemic" issues of racism have caused hurt to First Nations and culturally linguistic staff.

title.children: 'Hurt, helplessness': ABC review finds racism within broadcaster and staff targeted by external organisations

image.altText: A composite image of Donald Trump and Kamala Harris

props.synopsis: Americans face what looms as a tight and pivotal election on November 5. The battleground states are a factor but so is the fight for the overseas vote, including here, in Australia.

title.children: Pennsylvania, Arizona and Australia? Could Americans here help swing US election?

image.altText: Separate close-up headshots of Tim Walz and JD Vance.

props.synopsis: Tim Walz and JD Vance haven't spent much time on the national stage – so a lot of Americans don't know too much about them. The debate is one of their best shots to win over voters in an election race that remains tight.

title.children: Vice-presidential candidates Tim Walz and JD Vance are preparing to debate. Here's what to watch for

image.altText: Sold

props.synopsis: With negative gearing and capital gains tax back on the national agenda, experts say such reforms would be unlikely to lead to a major fall in property prices. But some investors say they could be forced to sell if there are changes to property tax breaks and that could force rents higher.

title.children: ‘It's going to be very uncertain for us’: Investors weigh in on negative gearing debate

image.altText: A plane sits on the runway at an airport. It is white with purple highlights and the word Bonza on the side.

props.synopsis: Investigators are examining why some money destined for a private investment firm's football teams instead went to Bonza. The airline collapsed barely a year after it launched.

title.children: US authorities investigating whether budget airline Bonza was funded with money meant for football teams

image.altText: Nicola Gobbo, known as Lawyer X, wearing a leopard print top stares out a window

props.synopsis: Lawyers for barrister-turned-informer Nicola Gobbo say she has lived in a state of fear and constant hiding during the past six years, with details of her secretive life revealed in court during her trial against the State of Victoria.

title.children: Court hears of Nicola Gobbo’s life in hiding, surgery and name change since outing as Lawyer X

image.altText: Aerial shot of a grey SUV driving on an unmarked road through vast field of drown and green grass.

props.synopsis: Some manufacturers said we'd be in self-driving cars by now and that hasn't quite played out. So where do driverless, hydrogen and electric vehicles fit in Australia's driving future?

title.children: Why Australia is so far behind other nations in EV sales, and how utes are part of the problem

image.altText: A graphic image showing the NDIS logo, a hand on a calculator, and stacks of folders.

props.synopsis: Significant changes to the National Disability Insurance Scheme start kicking in this week. Here's what you need to know.

title.children: A major NDIS change has just been finalised. Here's what you need to know

image.altText: Mech Dara receiving a certificate from Antony Blinken.

props.synopsis: Award-winning Cambodian investigative reporter Mech Dara is arrested in what's been described as a "retaliatory move" from the country's authoritarian rulers.

title.children: Journalist awarded for work on human trafficking in online scams arrested in Cambodia

image.altText: Debris is seen in the aftermath of Hurricane Helene

props.synopsis: It was one of the worst storms in US history, and a clearer picture of the damage is now emerging, with about 600 people believed to be missing.

title.children: Hurricane Helene death toll rises to over 120 across six south-eastern US states

image.altText: A blackened burnt-out bus shell is hosed down by several firefighters in full protective gear

props.synopsis: The school bus was taking students on a field trip before it caught fire on a road outside of the Thai capital Bangkok.

title.children: Thai school bus catches fire killing at least 23 people and injuring more than a dozen others

image.altText: a woman with long hair silhouetted against a blue sky with white clouds

props.synopsis: Andy wanted advice for body image and self-esteem issues. Her psychologist suggested she try Chinese acupuncture for breast growth.

title.children: 'Acupuncture for breast growth': Concerning advice from psychologists leaves young people reluctant to seek help

image.altText: Young woman smiling with sky, clouds and Nepal mountain in background

props.synopsis: Legal changes introduced in the wake of the September 11 attacks, which only took effect in 2022, mean that unless there are exceptional circumstances Australians are now limited to three name changes in a lifetime.

title.children: Anti-terrorism law change traps woman with 'hippie whim' name she doesn't use or want

image.altText: Ashley Klein makes a call during the 2024 NRL season

props.synopsis: The NRL has made its decision on who will oversee Sunday's grand final, with one official paying a big price for a blunder that took place during last weekend's preliminary finals.

title.children: Ashley Klein to officiate NRL grand final, as league snubs video referee slammed by Ivan Cleary

image.altText: Boris Johnson and the late Queen Elizabeth II greet eachother at Buckingham Palace in 2019.

props.synopsis: The former UK prime minister made the claim in an excerpt from his soon-to-be released memoir, Unleashed seen by British media.

title.children: Boris Johnson memoir claims Queen Elizabeth had bone cancer in her final years

image.altText: An image of a teenager's hand holding a vape.

props.synopsis: Australians aged 18 and over looking to buy a vape without a prescription can now do so legally under changes to national vaping legislation that come into effect today.

title.children: National laws mean vapes are available from pharmacies without a script, but two states are bucking the trend

image.altText: A man wearing shorts and sneakers wheeling a suitcase behind him.

props.synopsis: In August, New Zealand's central bank suddenly had to begin cutting as the economy plunged into recession. Many global counterparts have begun asking: Could we be next?

title.children: The great Kiwi rate hike experiment and where it all went wrong

image.altText: A Russian military aircraft Su-35 flies next to F-16 jet.

props.synopsis: The US military releases footage showing a Russian aircraft flying dangerously close to a US F-16 fighter jet near Alaska, in a manoeuvre known as "headbutting".

title.children: US military slams Russia for 'headbutting' F-16 fighter jet at close range off Alaska

image.altText: Stock image of a Virgin plane

props.synopsis: Qatar Airways will buy a 25 per cent stake in Virgin Australia after an agreement was reached between the Australian airline's owner, Bain Capital, and the Gulf carrier.

title.children: Virgin Australia hopes to expand international flight offerings after Qatar Airways agrees to buy 25pc stake

image.altText: Coles and Woolworths branding outside neighbouring supermarkets

props.synopsis: Federal and state treasurers will meet to change planning and zoning laws to end alleged "land banking" by the supermarket giants, where property is purchased and sat on to prevent competitors from entering.

title.children: Coles and Woolworths's alleged land hoarding comes under the microscope, as treasurers seek zoning law changes

image.altText: A serious man and a woman stand in field of crops, man, wears cap, looks down, woman looks away, blue sky, trees.

props.synopsis: Fiona and Rob Duff say rejecting the potential cash flow from wind turbines is not an ideological decision about climate change or energy.

title.children: Couple turns down wind turbines worth millions due to decommissioning concerns

image.altText: Troy Bell walks past the court building.

props.synopsis: Independent South Australian MP Troy Bell will appeal against the 25 guilty verdicts, relating to theft and dishonesty charges, which were handed down by a District Court jury last week.

title.children: MP found guilty of theft and fraud charges to appeal against verdicts

image.altText: A blue sky, many mountain peaks and a river in the foreground,

props.synopsis: Rising a couple of millimetres per year on average, Mt Everest is having a growth spurt. A new study suggests that a "pirated" river thousands of years ago might have given it a boost.

title.children: Why is Mt Everest growing twice as quickly as expected?
